intro: Jambosa rama-varmae, commonly known as the golden star fruit, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange, star-shaped fruits. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves with a slightly waxy texture, and its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically greenish-yellow in color. The fruit develops from an aggregate of follicles, each containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
